intro: Urostigma glanduliferum, commonly known as the glandular urostigma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a shrub characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic properties. Urostigma glanduliferum typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and potential medicinal research.
